Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Description: LifeLock agreed to pay $100 million to settle Federal Trade Commission contempt charges that it violated the terms of a 2010 federal court order that requires the company to secure consumers' personal information and prohibits the company from deceptive advertising.

LifeLock, Inc. agreed to pay $11 million to the Federal Trade Commission and $1 million to a group of 35 state attorneys general to settle charges that the company used false claims to promote its identity theft protection services, which it widely advertised by displaying the CEO's Social Security number on the side of a truck.

Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $50,001 to $100,000.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: LifeLock agreed to pay $1 million to settle multitstate litigation alleging the company misrepresented and overstated the identity theft protection services it offers to consumers. As part of the same settlement it agreed to hand over  $11 million to the Federal Trade Commission for customer restitution; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2010/03/lifelock-will-pay-12-million-settle-charges-ftc-35-states
